experience.title: Data Scientist
experience.description: Part of Ranking and Relevance team, Bing Shopping- Analysed the reason for CCR (conditional click rate) regression in a few markets, concluding reason to be that less popular offers are being selected and shown by the ranker compared to what was being show previously. This  facilitated inclusion of static rank, a popularity signal to the ranker, taken up by other team members. - Designed a stable metric based on discounted cumulative gain (DCG) score to analyse Bing Shopping results based on offer relevance to query, quality of offers, and savings aspects. -Automated the relevance quality measurement pipeline using Large Language Models (LLMs) as judges by prompt engineering the judgement guidelines for model input. This approach proved to be 60% cost effective while increasing the throughput by almost 10x-Analysed market-wise relevance-based DCG scores for Bing vs. Google Shopping for a fixed queryset. Tagged queries for categories using LLM, enabling slicing and dicing of data for further analysis. Created a monitoring dashboard for score comparison.- Analysed DST (dynalic shop tab) triggering and suppression, in order to find the reason behind a sudden volume drop for Shop tab in a specific time-period. Analysed Coverage, FSDAU and FCDAU, precision and recall of DST triggering, and suprresion by other verticals to reach to a possible conclusion. Created monitoring dashboard for future use, facilitating easy debugging for any future volume drop scenario.
